text: W. H. Applewhite House is a historic plantation house located near Stantonsburg, Wilson County, North Carolina. It was built about 1847, and is a two-story, three bay, single pile, Greek Revival style frame dwelling. It has a one-story, shed roofed rear wing. It features a double-gallery porch with sawn ornament and trim added about 1900. The house was remodeled about 1870–1880. Also on the property are the contributing tenant house, packhouse, stables, sheds, and tobacco barns. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1986. ==References== Category:Plantation houses in North Carolina Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Greek Revival houses in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1847 Category:Houses in Wilson County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Wilson County, North Carolina Category:1847 establishments in North Carolina
title: W. H. Applewhite House
